wiki.content:
"Open Letter to Duke" is a tribute to Duke Ellington, and draws on three of Mingus's earlier pieces ("Nouroog", "Duke's Choice", and "Slippers"). 
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Open Letter to Duke" is a tribute to Duke Ellington, and draws on three of Mingus's earlier pieces ("Nouroog", "Duke's Choice", and "Slippers").

name: Open Letter To Duke
comments: Is it me or is someone playing off pitch in this one at the start?
a little bit of caribbean calypso at the end

•	“mfranzwa wrote: 
Charles Mingus' Ah Um is an underrated masterpiece of modern jazz! Every Jazz fan should own this album.” – I don’t know if I agree about this being an underrated album. Every, and I mean every review I have ever seen of it rightly considers it a masterpiece. I do agree that everyone even remotely interested in finding out what’s great about jazz should hear this.
Fantastic Mingus. This song…this is just amazing. This is jazz. It really is.
